t: Jeremiah 30
Restoration of Israel and Judah
The*p word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord,*s saying,
“Thus speaks the Lord*s God of Israel, saying: ‘Write in a book for yourself all the words that I have spoken to you.

For behold, the days are coming,’ says the Lord,*s ‘that I will bring back from captivity My people Israel and Judah,’ says the Lord.*s ‘And I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.’”
Now*p these are*i the words that the Lord*s spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
“For*p thus says the Lord:*s ‘We*pn have heard a voice of trembling, Of*ld fear, and not of peace.
Ask*ld now, and see, Whether*ld a man is ever in labor with child? So*ld why do I see every man with*i his hands on his loins Like*ld a woman in labor, And*ld all faces turned pale?
Alas!*ld For that day is*i great, So*ld that none is*i like it; And*ld it is*i the time of Jacob’s trouble, But*ld he shall be saved out of it.
‘For*ln it shall come to pass in that day,’ Says*ld the Lord*s of hosts, ‘That*ild I will break his yoke from your neck, And*ld will burst your bonds; Foreigners*ld shall no more enslave them.
But*ld they shall serve the Lord*s their God, And*ld David their king, Whom*ld I will raise up for them.

‘Therefore*ln do not fear, O My servant Jacob,’ says the Lord,*s ‘Nor*ld be dismayed, O Israel; For*ld behold, I will save you from afar, And*ld your seed from the land of their captivity. Jacob*ld shall return, have rest and be quiet, And*ld no one shall make him*i afraid.

For*ld I am*i with you,’ says the Lord,*s ‘to save you; Though*ld I make a full end of all nations where I have scattered you, Yet*ld I will not make a complete end of you. But*ld I will correct you in justice, And*ld will not let you go altogether unpunished.’
“For*p thus says the Lord:*s ‘Your*pn affliction is*i incurable, Your*ld wound is*i severe.
There*ild is*i no one to plead your cause, That*ld you may be bound up; You*ld have no healing medicines.

All*ld your lovers have forgotten you; They*ld do not seek you; For*ld I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, With*ld the chastisement of a cruel one, For*ld the multitude of your iniquities, Because*ild your sins have increased.
Why*ld do you cry about your affliction? Your*ld sorrow is*i incurable. Because*ld of the multitude of your iniquities, Because*ild your sins have increased, I*ld have done these things to you.

‘Therefore*ln all those who devour you shall be devoured; And*ld all your adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; Those*ld who plunder you shall become plunder, And*ld all who prey upon you I will make a prey.
For*ld I will restore health to you And*ld heal you of your wounds,’ says the Lord,*s ‘Because*ld they called you an outcast saying:*i “This*ld is*i Zion; No*ld one seeks her.”’

“Thus*ln says the Lord:*s ‘Behold,*ln I will bring back the captivity of Jacob’s tents, And*ld have mercy on his dwelling places; The*ld city shall be built upon its own mound, And*ld the palace shall remain according to its own plan.

Then*ld out of them shall proceed thanksgiving And*ld the voice of those who make merry; I*ld will multiply them, and they shall not diminish; I*ld will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
Their*ld children also shall be as before, And*ld their congregation shall be established before Me; And*ld I will punish all who oppress them.

Their*ld nobles shall be from among them, And*ld their governor shall come from their midst; Then*ld I will cause him to draw near, And*ld he shall approach Me; For*ld who is*i this who pledged his heart to approach Me?’ says the Lord.*s
‘You*ld shall be My people, And*ld I will be your God.’”
Behold,*ln the whirlwind of the Lord*s Goes*ld forth with fury, A*ld continuing whirlwind; It*ld will fall violently on the head of the wicked.
The*ld fierce anger of the Lord*s will not return until He has done it, And*ld until He has performed the intents of His heart. In*ln the latter days you will consider it.
